intro: Onosma rigida, commonly known as rigid onosma, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are often narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Onosma rigida is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and is also studied for its potential medicinal properties.
